definition: An airline alliance is an agreement between two or more airlines to cooperate on a substantial level.
opposite_reasoning: AirlineAlliance represents a cooperative agreement structure between organizations. The clearest opposition is organizations in competitive (not cooperative) relationships. CompetingOrganizations captures the cooperation↔competition dimension which is the core semantic content. This has stronger opposition than generic concepts like SolitaryAgent while being more general and likely available than the domain-specific IndependentAirlineOperation. For Fisher-LDA, this provides a meaningful axis: cooperative organizational structures vs competitive organizational structures.
